Definition: Out of the facts given as input, select a fact which can be converted into a question of the form ‘Where is <person_name>?’. Give the question as the output.

Negative Examples.input: Passage: John went to the kitchen. John journeyed to the office.

Negative Examples.input: Passage: John went to the kitchen. John journeyed to the office.
Negative Examples.explanation: The name of the person asked in the question must be present in the input and in this case David is not mentioned in the input.

Negative Examples.input: Passage: John went to the kitchen. John journeyed to the office.
